intro: Commelina erecta, commonly known as the upright spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Commelinales order and the Commelinaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features erect, slender stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have three blue or violet petals with a white or yellow center. Commelina erecta is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
